name: Charged Perforator
desc: 10% chance on hit to down a lightning strike, dealing 500% (+500% per stack) damage .
notes:
The Charged Perforator is a boss item in Risk of Rain 2, dropped by the   Overloading Worm. 
When the holder damages an enemy, there is a 10% chance that lightning will strike that enemy, dealing 500% (+500% per stack) total damage.
The lightning strike has a proc coefficient of 1.0.


== Notes ==
Correction: This item does total damage, meaning it deals 500% of the damage of the hit that triggered it, not 500% base damage.
The lightning strike is almost identical to that of the  Royal Capacitor, in which they both have a delayed strike that can be avoided by the target if said target is fast enough.
Unlike all other total damage items, the Charged Perforator rolls its critical strike chance independently of the triggering hit; the rest of the total damage items will land critical strikes if and only if the activating hit is a critical strike.


== Tips ==
The Charged Perforator is especially effective for dealing with flying monsters, since the lightning strike deals severe downward knockback. An airborne enemy struck by lightning will be pushed down at high speeds, suffering heavy damage when it collides with the ground.
This is even more effective for monsters flying above bottomless pits, as they will be instantly killed when shoved downwards.
